# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=80)
    # Initialize a variable to store the output string
    output = ""

    # Create a vector of words by splitting text
    words = split(text)

    # Iterate over each word
    for word in words
        # Check if adding the word would exceed the text_width
        # If it does, add a newline and reset the line to an empty string
        # Concatenate the word and a space to the output string
        if length(output) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            output *= "\n"
            output *= word * " "
        else
            output *= word * " "
        end
    end

    return output
end
